verbose_text: Studies have shown that in cultured endothelial cells, an LPS induced increase in endothelial permeability occurs through several pathways, such as endothelial contraction caused by the RhoA dependent increase in myosin light chain kinase (MLC) phosphorylation, reorganization of actin filaments, protein tyrosine phosphorylation, etc..
evidence: RhoA-dependent increase in myosin light chain kinase (MLC) phosphorylation
